comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: I gather that this is a late 19th or early 20th century McKay 'Sunshine' stripper harvester. The little girl is sitting in the seat steering. Magnificent!

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: This pic appeared in a 1906-1907 harvest pictorial which was published in the Sydney Mail, 30/1/1907 (p. 284)...(this is the closest link I can find to the page!) - news.google.com/newspapers?id=bGpVAAAAIBAJ&sjid=eJUDA... ; some of the other pics which appeared in this 1906-1907 harvest pictorial were evidently taken at Ross brothers' farm, 'Combella', near Wellington...other pics were evidently taken near Orange and at Narromine...and I've also discovered that the Sydney Mail tended to pad out their feature articles with photos from their photo archive...so I wouldn't be too emphatic on the location/date of this pic...particularly given that Ross brothers appear to have used Nicholson & Morrow Union harvesters rather than the Mackay Sunshine... These other pics from the PHM collection also appeared in the Sydney Mail 1906-1907 harvest pictorial: www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2451472036/ www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2962972431/ www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/4903249927/ Also see this pic from the PHM Tyrrell Collection, which didn't make the Sydney Mail article...it also appears to have been taken at Ross brothers' farm near Wellington: www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2363514272/#/
